  1. /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2. *
  3. * globals.c
  4. *      global variable declarations
  5. *
  6. * Portions Copyright (c) 1996-2024, PostgreSQL Global Development Group
  7. * Portions Copyright (c) 1994, Regents of the University of California
  8. *
  9. *
  10. * IDENTIFICATION
  11. *      src/backend/utils/init/globals.c
  12. *
  13. * NOTES
  14. *      Globals used all over the place should be declared here and not
  15. *      in other modules.
  16. *
  17. *-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  18. */
  19. #include "postgres.h"

  21. #include "common/file_perm.h"
  22. #include "libpq/libpq-be.h"
  23. #include "libpq/pqcomm.h"
  24. #include "miscadmin.h"
  25. #include "storage/procnumber.h"


  28. ‌ProtocolVersion FrontendProtocol;

  30. ‌volatile sig_atomic_t InterruptPending = false;
  31. ‌volatile sig_atomic_t QueryCancelPending = false;
  32. ‌volatile sig_atomic_t ProcDiePending = false;

  45. ‌int            MyProcPid;

  47. ‌TimestampTz MyStartTimestamp;
  48. ‌struct ClientSocket *MyClientSocket;
  49. ‌struct Port *MyProcPort;
  50. ‌int32        MyCancelKey;
  51. ‌int            MyPMChildSlot;

  53. /*
  54. * MyLatch points to the latch that should be used for signal handling by the
  55. * current process. It will either point to a process local latch if the
  56. * current process does not have a PGPROC entry in that moment, or to
  57. * PGPROC->procLatch if it has. Thus it can always be used in signal handlers,
  58. * without checking for its existence.
  59. */
  60. ‌struct Latch *MyLatch;

  62. /*
  63. * DataDir is the absolute path to the top level of the PGDATA directory tree.
  64. * Except during early startup, this is also the server's working directory;
  65. * most code therefore can simply use relative paths and not reference DataDir
  66. * explicitly.
  67. */
  68. ‌char       *DataDir = NULL;

  70. /*
  71. * Mode of the data directory.  The default is 0700 but it may be changed in
  72. * checkDataDir() to 0750 if the data directory actually has that mode.
  73. */
  74. ‌int            data_directory_mode = PG_DIR_MODE_OWNER;

  76. ‌char        OutputFileName[MAXPGPATH];    /* debugging output file */

  78. ‌char        my_exec_path[MAXPGPATH];    /* full path to my executable */
  79. ‌char        pkglib_path[MAXPGPATH]; /* full path to lib directory */

  81. #ifdef EXEC_BACKEND
  82. ‌char        postgres_exec_path[MAXPGPATH];    /* full path to backend */

  84. /* note: currently this is not valid in backend processes */
  85. #endif

  87. ‌ProcNumber    MyProcNumber = INVALID_PROC_NUMBER;

  89. ‌ProcNumber    ParallelLeaderProcNumber = INVALID_PROC_NUMBER;

  91. ‌Oid            MyDatabaseId = InvalidOid;

  93. ‌Oid            MyDatabaseTableSpace = InvalidOid;

  95. ‌bool        MyDatabaseHasLoginEventTriggers = false;

  97. /*
  98. * DatabasePath is the path (relative to DataDir) of my database's
  99. * primary directory, ie, its directory in the default tablespace.
  100. */
  101. ‌char       *DatabasePath = NULL;

  103. ‌pid_t        PostmasterPid = 0;

  105. /*
  106. * IsPostmasterEnvironment is true in a postmaster process and any postmaster
  107. * child process; it is false in a standalone process (bootstrap or
  108. * standalone backend).  IsUnderPostmaster is true in postmaster child
  109. * processes.  Note that "child process" includes all children, not only
  110. * regular backends.  These should be set correctly as early as possible
  111. * in the execution of a process, so that error handling will do the right
  112. * things if an error should occur during process initialization.
  113. *
  114. * These are initialized for the bootstrap/standalone case.
  115. */
  116. ‌bool        IsPostmasterEnvironment = false;
  117. ‌bool        IsUnderPostmaster = false;
  118. ‌bool        IsBinaryUpgrade = false;

  120. ‌bool        ExitOnAnyError = false;

  122. ‌int            DateStyle = USE_ISO_DATES;
  123. ‌int            DateOrder = DATEORDER_MDY;
  124. ‌int            IntervalStyle = INTSTYLE_POSTGRES;

  126. ‌bool        enableFsync = true;
  127. ‌bool        allowSystemTableMods = false;
  128. ‌int            work_mem = 4096;
  129. ‌double        hash_mem_multiplier = 2.0;
  130. ‌int            maintenance_work_mem = 65536;
  131. ‌int            max_parallel_maintenance_workers = 2;

  133. /*
  134. * Primary determinants of sizes of shared-memory structures.
  135. *
  136. * MaxBackends is computed by PostmasterMain after modules have had a chance to
  137. * register background workers.
  138. */
  139. ‌int            NBuffers = 16384;
  140. ‌int            MaxConnections = 100;
  141. ‌int            max_worker_processes = 8;
  142. ‌int            max_parallel_workers = 8;
  143. ‌int            MaxBackends = 0;

  145. /* GUC parameters for vacuum */
  146. ‌int            VacuumBufferUsageLimit = 2048;

  148. ‌int            VacuumCostPageHit = 1;
  149. ‌int            VacuumCostPageMiss = 2;
  150. ‌int            VacuumCostPageDirty = 20;
  151. ‌int            VacuumCostLimit = 200;
  152. ‌double        VacuumCostDelay = 0;

  154. ‌int64        VacuumPageHit = 0;
  155. ‌int64        VacuumPageMiss = 0;
  156. ‌int64        VacuumPageDirty = 0;

  158. ‌int            VacuumCostBalance = 0;    /* working state for vacuum */
  159. ‌bool        VacuumCostActive = false;

  161. /* configurable SLRU buffer sizes */
  162. ‌int            commit_timestamp_buffers = 0;
